snippet: The Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals met in court over their shared network, MASN, highlighting several problems with cable sports broadcasting.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column examines court case between Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals, two first-place MLB teams that share same market and are both carried by the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network; argues that case, including battle over money and accusations of extortion and conflicts of interests, highlights several problems with cable sports broadcasting.
lead_paragraph: The Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals met in court over their shared network, MASN, highlighting several problems with cable sports broadcasting.

headline.print_headline: The Market? Shared. The Network? Divided.
headline.seo: MASN Pits Orioles Against Nationals After Years of Coexistence
headline.main: The Market? Shared. The Network? Divided.
